    CNN #

    Intro #

    • HÃ—WÃ—CH\times W \times CHÃ—WÃ—C â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ too large â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ too many parameters â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ Need Conv.

    • Edge detection by a filter (3x3 for example) (or kernel) â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ multiply with original image by a convulution operator (*)

      • Sobel filter, Scharr filter (not only 0, 1, -1)

      • Can use backprop to learn the value of filter.

      • Not only edge, we can learn by degree of images.

    Padding #

    • We don't want image to shrink everytime
      • (6Ã—6)âˆ—(3Ã—3)(6\times 6) \ast (3\times 3)(6Ã—6)âˆ—(3Ã—3) (filter) â‡’4Ã—4\Rightarrow 4\times 4â‡’4Ã—4
      • (nÃ—n)âˆ—(fÃ—f)â‡’(nâˆ’f+1)Ã—(nâˆ’f+1)(n\times n) \ast (f\times f) \Rightarrow (n-f+1) \times (n-f+1)(nÃ—n)âˆ—(fÃ—f)â‡’(nâˆ’f+1)Ã—(nâˆ’f+1)
    • We don't want pixel on the corner or edges are used much less on the outputs
    • â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ we can pad the images (expand more all around the images): 6Ã—66\times 66Ã—6 â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ (pad 1) â‡’8Ã—8\Rightarrow 8\times 8â‡’8Ã—8
      • (8Ã—8)âˆ—(3Ã—3)(8\times 8) \ast (3\times 3)(8Ã—8)âˆ—(3Ã—3) â‡’6Ã—6\Rightarrow 6\times 6â‡’6Ã—6 (instead of 4Ã—44\times 44Ã—4)
      • â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ (n+2pâˆ’f+1)Ã—(n+2pâˆ’f+1)(n+2p-f+1) \times (n+2p-f+1)(n+2pâˆ’f+1)Ã—(n+2pâˆ’f+1)
    • 2 common choices:
      • valid conv â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ no padding: (nÃ—n)âˆ—(fÃ—f)â‡’(nâˆ’f+1)Ã—(nâˆ’f+1)(n\times n) * (f\times f) \Rightarrow (n-f+1) \times (n-f+1)(nÃ—n)âˆ—(fÃ—f)â‡’(nâˆ’f+1)Ã—(nâˆ’f+1)
      • same conv â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ out's size = in's size â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ choose p=fâˆ’12p=\frac{f-1}{2}p=2fâˆ’1â€‹
    • fff is usually odd â‡’\Rightarrowâ‡’ just a convention. 3Ã—33\times 33Ã—3, 5Ã—55\times 55Ã—5 are very common.
